cause.description:
Ovarian Cancer is the least known, least funded, and most deadly of all women cancers. It kills over 85% of women who get the disease in 5 years or less. Few find out they have the cancer before it reaches its final stages.
Because this cancer is nick-named the "whisper cancer" the symptoms seem to be those of a common cold. The age range for this disease has been updated to before 10 years old and ranges to elderly years around 80 years. Though it is uncommon for a child to contract this cancer, it is possible. In 2006 only 14 children in the world had ovarian cancer under the age of 15.
This is a cause to help those in need. All we need is some support to do it.
1. All cancers should be funded equally, not just a specific few.
2. There are more than just Breast and Cervical cancers for women.
3. Awareness.
cause.mission: Educate and help to fund research for Ovarian Cancer
cause.name: Parvin Ovarian Cancer Fund
